basics.name: David
basics.label: Computer Engineer
basics.summary: Hi, I'm David Sánchez Jiménez, I'm from Granada, Spain and I'm working in Legit.Health as Frontend Developer. I love participating in events as an assistant, organizer or speaker, I think it is very important to learn new technologies and meet people.

highlights: Working on Legit.Health company. Legit.Health is the Revolutionary Clinical Data and Communication tool for Next-generation dermatologists that triples the empowerment of patients.

Legit.Health assists doctors in making more accurate diagnoses and treatment decisions. It also aids with routine tasks such as follow-up consultations, enabling doctors to identify potential problems more quickly and accurately. Additionally, Legit.Health supports administrative tasks like scheduling appointments and managing medical records, thereby freeing up time for healthcare providers to focus on patient care.
In my day to day I work with Typescript, React, Next.js.
Working on Katholiek Onderwijs Vlaanderen or ”KathOndVla” project. KathOndVla is the umbrella organization for Catholic education in Flanders, Belgium.
The goal of this project is design, develop and maintain the diferent platforms used by Catholic education schools.
In my day to day I work with Javascript, React, AngularJS, Mocha and Jenkins.

Working on ”SDK, Tooling and Infrastructure” team on the Fonto project. Fonto is a web-XML-based editor that allows companies to write any type of document regardless of their particular requirements or needs.

The goal of this team is design, develop and maintain the platform used by all XML editors. Also, this team is responsible for the correct functioning of the tools provided to partners as well as the Software Development Kit used by the rest of the company’s developers.
I was part of the team in charge of migrating all the platform Javascript code to TypeScript.
In my day to day I work with Javascript, Typescript, Gatsby, Babel and Azure.
I worked on a features team on the Fonto project. Fonto is a web-based XML editor that allows companies to write any type of document regardless of their particular requirements or needs.
During this period of time I participated in the design, implementation and modification of some editor functionalities according to the client’s needs.
In my day to day I worked with JavaScript and React.

During my university internship I did an onboarding to start working at Fonto project. Fonto is a web-based XML editor that allows companies to write any type of document regardless of their particular requirements or needs.
I worked on a features team and I participated in the design, implementation and modification of some editor functionalities according to the client’s needs.
In my day to day I worked with JavaScript and React.
I worked as Full-Stack developer in a project using Python, MongoDB, Elasticsearch and Angular during summer internship.

work.company: Colegio Oficial de Gestores Administrativos de Granada
highlights: I worked as a systems administrator in my internship for the Higher Education Network and Systems Administration Certificate.

projects.title: Web interface for indexing and searching financial texts with Elasticsearch
highlights: This work aims to develop a platform for searching and visualizing data in a Financial Corpus, understanding as Corpus an extensive and ordered set of data or texts of various kinds, such as scientific or literary, which serve as the basis for a investigation.
This solution is composed of a frontend, made with React, which communicateswith a backend, made with Express.js, through a REST API.
The backend also makes request to an Elasticsearch database.
The Elasticsearch database is hosted in AWS and contains the indexed texts of the Financial Corpus.

extraCurricularActivities.title: Google Developer Group Granada
highlights: The Google Developer Groups (GDGs) are non-profit entities created with the aim of improving the technological enthusiast community and increasing the knowledge and relationships among people who are dedicated to this area. GDG Granada is the local branch of this community.
I organized numerous events and talks just for fun during this period.
In May 2018 ETSIIT awarded us a diploma for the work done during the academic year 2017/2018.

awards.title: Diploma
highlights: For the work done during the academic year 2017/2018 with the Google Developer Group Granada.
